name: Poached Pears (Poires Pochees)
author: Inthelight717
summary: Pears poached in red wine are an elegant dessert full of festive holiday spice flavor, including cinnamon, star anise, and vanilla extract. I like to serve this drizzled or drenched with creme anglaise sauce.
directions: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan
Add lemon juice and pears and let sit for 2 minutes
Remove pears from the hot water 1 at a time and carefully peel, leaving stem intact
Combine wine, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and star anise in a medium-sized saucepan and bring to a boil
Rinse pears and add to the boiling wine mixture
Use a plate on top of pears to keep them submerged
Simmer until a knife very easily pierces the pears, 10 to 15 minutes
Remove saucepan from heat and allow pears to cool in the wine mixture
Serve pears in a bowl, either whole or sliced and cored
